701.01 et seq.
 
901.01  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall open up or break into the streets, lanes, alleys, public
ways or public grounds for the purpose of connecting with water or gas pipes or
with the sewers, drains or ditches, or for any other purpose whatsoever until
that person has first obtained a permit from the Municipal Administrator to
make the opening, prior to commencement of the work.
901.02  APPLICATION AND DEPOSIT.
   The application for a permit under this chapter shall give the exact
location, the proposed opening, the kind of pavement, the size of the
excavation and such other information as may be required. The permit shall not
be issued until the applicant has given a cash deposit sufficient to cover the
cost of restoration, which deposit shall be returned to the applicant upon the
prompt and satisfactory restoration of all surfaces disturbed.
(Ord. 253. Passed 9-23-47.)
901.03  PERFORMANCE UNDER DIRECTION OF PUBLIC WORKS DIRECTOR.
   The opening and the restoration of a pavement or other surface shall be
performed under the direction of the Public Works Director and in accordance
with regulations approved by the Municipal Administrator.
901.04  RESTORATION OF SURFACE; FORFEITURE OF DEPOSIT.
   If the applicant fails or refuses to restore the surface to a satisfactory
condition or fails to remove all excess materials within a reasonable time, the
City may proceed to make the restoration and remove the material and the
deposit referred to in Section
901.02 shall be deemed forfeited. Thereupon, this deposit shall be paid into
the Street Maintenance, Construction, and Repair Fund. If the cost of
restoration is greater than the amount of the deposit, the Clerk of Council
shall proceed to collect the balance due from the applicant.
(Ord. 253. Passed 9-23-47.)
901.05  BARRIERS AND WARNING LIGHTS.
   Every person making or having made openings or excavations in the streets,
alleys, lanes or public places of the City shall at all times guard the same
with sufficient and suitable guard rails and with proper lights to warn and
protect persons and animals traveling upon those streets and public ways.
(Ord. 253. Passed 9-23-47.)
901.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter for which no other penalty is
provided shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00).
CHAPTER 903
Establishing Grades
903.01   Establishing and changing grades; procedures; publication of notice.
903.02   Appeals to be filed.
903.03   Hearing.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
      Surface treatment of streets - see Ohio R.C. 723.23, 723.31
      Excavation liability - see Ohio R.C. 723.49 et seq.
      Changing established grade - see Ohio R.C. 727.07
 
 
903.01  ESTABLISHING AND CHANGING GRADES; PROCEDURES;     PUBLICATION OF
NOTICE.
   Council shall at all times have the power to establish the grade and change
the grade already established of any street, alley, boulevard, parkway, public
highway or any part thereof as often as deemed best for the public interest and
cause the same or any part thereof to be graded to the established grade or to
any change thereof.
   However, when a change is proposed to be made in the grade of any street,
alley, parkway, public highway or any part thereof which has once been
established, Council shall, by resolution, declare the change to be necessary
and shall cause a notice of the resolution, giving the name of the street or
highway, the limits between which the grade thereof is proposed to be changed
and the date on or before which any objection thereto must be filed with the
Clerk of Council, to be published in the local newspaper at least once, ten
days before any action is taken by Council on the matter.
(Ord. 260. Passed 12-9-47.)
903.02  APPEALS TO BE FILED.
   Thereafter, unless the resident owners of the City owning the majority in
front feet of all the lands belonging to resident owners fronting on the
street, alley, parkway, public highway or any part thereof proposed to be
improved, within ten days, file with the Clerk of Council their objections
against the proposed change, Council has power by ordinance to cause the
proposed change to be made.
(Ord. 260. Passed 12-9-47.)
903.03  HEARING.
   If the objections of a majority of resident owners are filed pursuant to
Section
903.02, the power of Council to make the proposed change in the grade of the
street, alley, parkway, public highway or any part thereof shall not be
exercised until after a hearing on the objections. Thereafter, Council may take
whatever action it deems best for the general interest.
(Ord. 260. Passed 12-9-47.)

CROSS REFERENCES
      Changing established grade - see Ohio R.C. 727.07
      Construction or repair at owner's expense - see Ohio R.C. 729.01 et seq.
      Notice to construct or repair - see Ohio R.C. 729.03 et seq.
 
905.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)    "Construction" means the construction of new work where no work has
previously been done.
   (b)    "Contractor" means any person or company licensed by the City to
construct or reconstruct walks or driveways, and to perform other work
permitted under this chapter, acting directly or through a duly authorized
representative.
   (c)    "Curb opening" means that part of a curb which has been or is cut,
dropped or replaced.
   (d)    "Driveway" means any driveway approach or runway between the curb
line and a private property line. If no curb is present then "driveway" means
any driveway approach between the traveled portion of the road and a private
property line.
   (e)    "Inspector" means the inspector designated by the Municipal
Administrator.
   (f)    "Owner" means the owner, leaseholder or agent thereof holding title,
possession or control to any private property adjoining any street in the City.
   (g)    "Reconstruction" means the relaying, rebuilding or repair of old work
in part or in whole.
   (h)    "Right of way" means any public property dedicated for public use as
a street, avenue, boulevard, lane, alley or public thoroughfare.
   (i)    "Street" means any public thoroughfare dedicated for public use.
   (j)    "Walk" means any main or approach sidewalk, between the curb line and
a private property line.
      (Ord. 2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.02  RESPONSIBILITY FOR MAINTENANCE.
   (a)    Where required by Council, every owner of any lot or parcel of land
situated within the corporate limits of the City shall construct, keep, repair
and maintain, along all public streets, avenues, boulevards or lanes adjoining
thereto, sidewalks as recommended by standard engineering practices and as
approved by the City Engineer.
   (b)    The cost of such construction, keeping and maintaining shall be the
responsibility of the individual property owner, or of the City and the
property owner together, as determined from time to time by Council.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.03  COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   All sidewalks, driveway approaches, runways or curb openings hereafter
constructed, reconstructed or made on any public street, avenue, boulevard or
lane within the corporate limits of the City shall be constructed,
reconstructed or made, and shall be used and maintained, in accordance with
this chapter.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.04  LICENSE REQUIRED; EXCEPTION; INSURANCE.
   (a)    No person, except the owner of the property who is personally doing
such work on the public right of way adjoining such property, shall construct
or reconstruct any sidewalk or driveway, or cut, drop or remove any curb on a
public right of way, without first posting a bond and obtaining a license to
engage in such work. However, any owner doing any such work at such property
shall fully abide by and conform to this chapter, except the requirement of
posting bond and procuring a license.
   (b)   Any person who applies for a license hereunder shall, prior to any
license being issued, furnish to the City, through its duly authorized
representatives, satisfactory evidence that he or she has presently in force a
contractor’s liability policy protecting the owner of the property, the City
and the general public; worker’s compensation insurance; and unemployment
insurance, whether either or both are applicable.
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.05  BOND REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Any person licensed to engage in the construction or reconstruction of
walks or driveways, or to make curb openings, shall file with the Municipal
Administrator a bond in an amount to be established by ordinance, the surety
thereon to be approved by the Municipal Administrator as to sufficiency, and
such bond shall be subject to approval by the Law Director as to form.  The
bond to the City shall be conditioned upon the faithful observance of this
chapter and other applicable provisions of these Codified Ordinances and the
specifications, rules or regulations pertaining to the construction and
reconstruction of walks, driveways or curb openings, and upon the principal
constructing, reconstructing or making all walks, driveways or curb openings in
strict compliance with all applicable existing ordinances, specifications,
rules and regulations of the City.
(Ord.  99-010.  Passed 4-12-99.)
   (b)   The bond shall further provide for payment to the City, or to all
persons entitled thereto, of the cost and expense of reconstructing any walk,
driveway or curb opening when required by the Municipal Administrator if any
defect due to construction, material or workmanship develops in such work at
any time within a period of one year from January 1 next following the
completion of the work, which defect is, in the judgment of the Municipal
Administrator, caused by the contractor’s failure to conform to the
specifications and regulations relating to the construction or reconstruction
of walks, driveways or curb openings, which specifications and regulations are
established under this chapter.  The bond shall be further conditioned upon
such surety indemnifying and saving harmless the City on account of any and all
claims, damages or injuries to persons or property due to failure of the
contractor or his or her agents or servants to maintain the right of way, where
such construction or reconstruction is being done, in a condition which is safe
and fit for public travel, and in compliance with this chapter or any
ordinance, rule or regulation relating to public safety now in effect or which
may hereafter be enacted or promulgated.
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.06  LICENSE APPLICATION.
   (a)   A person desiring to engage in the construction, reconstruction or
making of walks, driveways or curb openings in the City shall apply to the
Municipal Administrator for a license to engage in such activity, upon forms
furnished therefor.  Such application shall set forth:
      (1)   Individual.  Name in full and address.
      (2)   Partnership.  Names in full, evidence of legal organization of
partnership in accordance with the laws of the State, business address and
names in full and address of each person in the partnership.
      (3)   Corporation.  Name of the corporation; state of incorporation;
name, title and signature of official or officials authorized to sign the
application; and such further information as may be required by the Municipal
Administrator.
   (b)   The applicant shall further furnish the Municipal Administrator with
information as to his or her ability to do and perform all work as required in
the construction or reconstruction of walks, driveways or curb openings.
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.07  LICENSE FEE; ISSUANCE.
   When an application for a license required by this chapter has been approved
and the required bond has been accepted, the Municipal Administrator shall
issue a license to the applicant upon payment of the annual license fee, the
amount of which is to be established by ordinance.  The license shall be valid
during the calendar year of issue.  Any paving contractor performing any work
for which a permit is required by this chapter, who has not first obtained the
license required by this section, shall be fined an amount equal to the license
fee.  Any license that is issued in November or December shall be valid for the
following calendar year.
(Ord.  99-010.  Passed 4-12-99.)
905.08  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE; APPEALS TO COUNCIL.
   The Municipal Administrator may suspend or revoke a license or permit issued
hereunder for incompetency or for any failure, refusal or neglect on the part
of the holder thereof, or on the part of any agent or servant of the holder
thereof, to strictly comply with any part of this chapter or any effective
rule, regulation or specification relating to the use, construction,
reconstruction or making of walks, driveways or curb openings, or for failure
to pay for charges for materials, labor, subcontractors or employees for such
work for which a mechanic’s lien is filed against the owner of the property. 
The holder of any such permit or license may appeal from such suspension or
revocation to Council, and the findings of Council in all such appeals shall be
final and conclusive.
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.09  CONSTRUCTION PERMITS.
   (a)   Application.  An application for a permit to construct or reconstruct
a walk or driveway, or to make a curb opening, shall be on forms furnished by
the Municipal Administrator.  The forms shall set forth the name and address of
the applicant; the name and address of the owner of the property adjoining the
right of way where the proposed work is to be done; the street address and
legal description of the lot or land adjoining the right of way; the number of
square feet of proposed walk or driveway to be constructed or reconstructed or
the number of linear feet of curbing cut, dropped or removed; the width of the
present walk, driveway or curb opening; the material in the present walk,
driveway or curb; the material to be used in the proposed construction or
reconstruction of the walk; and such other information as may be required.  No
walk shall be constructed or reconstructed until a permit has been obtained
from the Municipal Administrator by the owner of the contiguous property or his
or her agent.  A licensed contractor shall ascertain that a permit has been
procured before he or she constructs or reconstructs any sidewalk or driveway
or makes any curb opening.  The permit shall be kept on the site of the
construction or reconstruction until completion of the work. 
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
   (b)   Fees.
      (1)   Fees for curb cut, sidewalk and driveway construction permits shall
be established by ordinance.  No permit shall be issued until the required fee
is paid.
         (Ord.  99-009.  Passed 4-12-99.)
      (2)   Fees shall be payable at the office of the Finance Director.  In
the case of reconstruction, fees may be waived at the discretion of the
Director if it is determined that the condition giving rise to the need for
reconstruction was caused by the City.
         (Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90; Ord.  97-073.  Passed 12-22-97.)
905.10  NOTICE TO CONSTRUCT OR RECONSTRUCT.
   Notice to construct or reconstruct walks or driveways or to make curb
openings shall be as provided by law.  Council may, by resolution, order
sidewalks or driveways to be repaired or reconstructed, and the costs thereof
shall be assessed and collected as provided by law.
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.11  CONSTRUCTION BY CITY; COSTS.
   If the owner neglects to construct or reconstruct a walk or driveway within
the time specified by Council, the Municipal Administrator shall construct or
reconstruct such walk or driveway or cause the same to be done.  In such case,
the cost and expense of constructing or reconstructing such walk or driveway
shall, as directed by ordinance of Council, be assessed as provided by law
against the adjoining or abutting property, lot or land.
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.12  CURB CUTS.
   All concrete or stone curbs shall be cut by an experienced and competent
curb cutter, and the dropping or removal of any curb shall be done only by an
experienced curb setter.  The replacing of a curb shall be done by the owner or
by the City, through the Municipal Administrator by contract or by force
account as the Municipal Administrator may deem best, and the cost and expense
for such work shall be charged against the private property contiguous to the
right of way where such curb was replaced.  No curb opening shall be less than
twelve linear feet in width nor of a greater width than approved by the
Municipal Administrator. 
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.13  LOCATION OF SIDEWALKS.
   Walks shall be located on the public right of way as determined by the
Municipal Administrator. 
(Ord.  2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.14  CONSTRUCTION SPECIFICATIONS.
   (a)    No concrete walk shall be less than four inches in thickness. The
width shall be a minimum of four feet. Concrete walk across driveways shall not
be less than six inches in thickness.
   (b)    In the repairing of sidewalks, no patching shall be allowed except
where needed to temporarily maintain an impervious surface. Temporary repairs
can be made with asphalt at the discretion of the Municipal Administrator.
   (c)    Any stone or concrete slab that can be trimmed to not less than four
feet for the full width may be used when specifically permitted by the
Municipal Administrator, providing that the adjoining slab is not less than
four feet, and no closure of any walk shall be less than four feet for the full
width of the slab.
   (d)    Sidewalks over subspaces shall not be permitted.
   (e)    All driveways between the curb line and walk shall be constructed
with a six-inch thick plain concrete slab or a two-inch thick asphaltic
concrete surface course on a six inch thick stone base. The kind of material
and the construction specifications therefor are subject to approval by the
Municipal Administrator. Unless specifically authorized by the Municipal
Administrator, the sidewalk within the limits of the driveway shall be six-inch
plain concrete only, for a minimum width of one foot beyond the driveway on
each side, and shall be effectively separated from the four-inch sidewalk by an
expansion joint. The driveway shall be the same width at the curb line as the
curb opening and not less than eight feet in width at the street side of the
sidewalk.
   (f)    When and if any driveway is no longer used for driveway purposes, it
shall be considered abandoned and the City reserves and shall have the right to
take the necessary steps to close the driveway, replace the curb and restore
the right of way to its original condition. The owner of the property served by
such driveway shall be notified by personal service or certified mail of the
City's intention to close the driveway. After fifteen days from the date of
notice, if the owner has failed to make the replacement or to contact the
Municipal Administrator, the Municipal Administrator shall proceed with the
work of restoring the curb and right of way to the original condition. The cost
of such work shall be charged against the abutting property, and if not paid,
shall be certified to the proper taxing authority for collection in the manner
provided by law.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.15  INSPECTIONS AND NOTICES PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION.
   No walks or driveways shall be constructed or reconstructed until lines and
levels are authorized and given by the Municipal Administrator. Driveways
constructed or reconstructed where the same is to be used in conjunction with a
filling station or commercial or industrial building, if such driveway is less
than sixty-five feet from the intersecting curb line to its nearest side on the
stop side of any main thoroughfare, shall be reviewed and authorized by the
Municipal Administrator. Notice shall be given to the Municipal Administrator
not less than twenty-four hours nor more than forty-eight hours prior to
starting the work on any driveway or sidewalk.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.16  INSTALLATION OF UTILITY FIXTURES OR SIDEWALK GRATINGS.
   Any person installing or placing, or causing to be installed or placed, any
curb box for gas or water, manhole covers, or sidewalk gratings shall install
them so that they are on an exact level with the surface of the walk or
driveway in existence or to be constructed or reconstructed. All such castings
made of metal shall be wrapped with expansion joint material prior to the
placing of concrete.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.17  PROTECTION OF FIRE HYDRANTS, VEGETATION AND GUTTERS; BARRICADES AND
WARNING LIGHTS.
   (a)    Any person constructing, reconstructing or removing walks, driveways
or curb openings, or causing the same to be done, shall, at all times, maintain
free access to fire hydrants. No material or dirt shall be stacked, piled or
placed within fifteen feet of such fire hydrants Such person shall protect all
trees, lawns, shrubbery and other improvements from damage. Street gutters
shall, at all times, be kept free of dirt or debris.
   (b)    Where it is necessary to place any material, debris or dirt on public
property, such material, debris or dirt shall be removed on the completion of
the work and the surface restored to its previous condition. The Municipal
Administrator shall, if in his or her opinion it is necessary, require the
person doing or causing such work to be done to seed or resod such part of any
lawn as he or she may deem necessary.
   (c)    Any person performing any such work shall maintain such proper
barricades, fences, signal lights or other protection as shall conform to
applicable ordinances or safety regulations, shall maintain access to private
entrance walks and safe accommodations for pedestrian traffic and shall, so far
as possible, maintain access to private driveways.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.18  DRAINAGE FOR WALKS.
   Drainage for walks shall be provided by grading between the walk and the
curb or ditch, at such places as may be necessary in the opinion of and as
directed by the Municipal Administrator. The cost shall be borne by the owner
of the property abutting the right of way.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.19  GRADES GENERALLY.
   (a)    All grades for walks shall conform to street grades, which shall be
established by the Municipal Administrator.
   (b)    All walks and driveways shall be constructed or reconstructed to
conform to the grade on the right of way where the grade has been established.
   (c)    The surface of all walks shall have a transverse slope of one-fourth
inch to one-half inch per foot, with the low side nearest to the curb line.
   (d)    Whenever permission is requested and granted to construct or
reconstruct a walk where the surface of such walk has a transverse slope of a
rate of more than one-half inch to the foot, the permit shall be granted and
received only on the condition that Council may, at any time thereafter, order
such walk to be reconstructed to the established grade of the right of way,
entirely at the expense of the abutting property owner.
   (e)    Upon a right of way where the grade has been established but where
the street has not been improved by paving or grading to such grade, walks
shall be constructed in conformity with the established grade or as specified
in the legislation providing for the construction or reconstruction of walks,
driveways and curb openings. However, when walks shall be ordered by Council or
shall be constructed or reconstructed without such order by the owner of
property abutting on a right of way where no grade is established, such walks
may be constructed or reconstructed at such levels and inclinations as may be
prescribed by the Municipal Administrator. When permission is requested of and
granted by the Municipal Administrator to construct or reconstruct a walk on
such right of way, it shall be granted and the walk shall be constructed or
reconstructed only on the condition that when a grade shall be established,
such walk may have to be removed and reconstructed to the new grade which may
thereafter be established by the Municipal Administrator for such street,
entirely at the expense of the owner of the property abutting on such street.
   (f)    Whenever a sidewalk is reconstructed to a grade that does not meet
the grade of adjacent existing walks, the person constructing the new sidewalk
shall construct a ramp not to exceed a longitudinal slope of one inch per foot
to eliminate any stub toes or grade inequality. The materials, workmanship and
character of the ramp shall be as determined by the Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.20  UNIFORMITY OF GRADES.
   All walks hereafter constructed or reconstructed on any right of way in the
City shall be constructed or reconstructed on such plans, inclination and level
that the wearing surface thereof shall be uniform and even throughout the right
of way. All walks in the City shall be maintained in such repair by the owner
of property abutting the right of way that the surface of the walk in front of
the abutting property on any right of way shall be uniform and even throughout
its length and width with the adjoining and connecting walks. All new lateral
walks, from the main sidewalk to the property line, hereafter constructed,
shall have a uniform slope from the main sidewalk to the property line of from
one-fourth inch to one-half inch per foot. The low end of the new lateral walk
shall be adjacent to the main sidewalk, and the lateral walk shall meet the
grade of the main sidewalk. The intent of this section is to exclude steps or
other abrupt changes in grade on the right of way.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.21  SUSPENSION OF WORK.
   The owner or contractor shall suspend all work regulated by this chapter
when notified by the Municipal Administrator that the weather is unsuitable for
carrying on the work. If work is allowed during cold or freezing weather, the
owner or contractor shall take such additional precautions as the Municipal
Administrator shall require or as set forth in the specifications.  No work
shall be placed on frozen subgrade.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.22  CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS.
   (a)    The owner or contractor shall furnish satisfactory evidence as to the
kind and quality of materials intended for use in the construction or
reconstruction of walks or driveways, either separately or in combination.
   (b)    Such material shall be packaged and marked so as to permit
identification.
   (c)    All material used on any work shall be subject to tests, for the
purpose of ascertaining quality, strength, durability, etc., and for the
purpose of ascertaining that the same meets the requirements of the
specifications for the construction or reconstruction of walks and driveways as
established by the Municipal Administrator.
   (d)    Walks shall be constructed of materials approved by the Municipal
Administrator.
   (e)    Whenever the Municipal Administrator deems it necessary, bituminous
material shall be placed adjacent to all telephone or power poles or other
structures which are within the limits of a sidewalk. The materials,
workmanship and character of this construction shall be determined by the
Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.23  SUPERVISION.
   (a)    The Municipal Administrator shall, at all times, have access to the
work regulated by this chapter, and the contractor shall provide proper
facilities or cause the same to be provided for the inspection of all work.
   (b)    The owner or contractor shall have a responsible representative in
charge of the work on the site at all times, and he or she shall have the
necessary qualifications and authority to execute, adhere to and carry out all
the requirements of this chapter and of the specifications for the construction
or reconstruction of walks, driveways or curb openings, on file in the office
of the Municipal Administrator.
   (c)    Orders or instructions from the Municipal Administrator or from the
inspector given to the representative shall be as binding as though given to
the owner or contractor. If any person employed on the work refuses or neglects
to comply with the direction of the work, or, in the opinion of the Municipal
Administrator, the City Engineer or the inspector, is incompetent, disorderly
or dilatory in the completion of his work, such person shall be immediately
removed and not again employed on any part of the work.
   (d)    The Municipal Administrator may assign an inspector to the work or
such part thereof as may be necessary. However, the presence of the inspector
shall not in any way relieve the owner or contractor from any responsibility in
complying with the specifications relating to the construction or
reconstruction of walks, driveways or curb openings. Any work done or performed
contrary to this chapter or the applicable rules or specifications shall, upon
direction of the Municipal Administrator, be made good or removed as directed.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.24  RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The Municipal Administrator is hereby authorized to adopt, promulgate, amend
and enforce such administrative rules and regulations as may be necessary to
execute and enforce this chapter.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.25  SEPARATE PERMITS REQUIRED.
   An individual permit shall be required for each separate job for which a
charge shall be made.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.26  SIDEWALKS IN SUBDIVISIONS.
   In all new subdivisions, the requirements of the Subdivision Regulations
concerning sidewalks shall be complied with by the developer, and the required
sidewalks shall be provided at the expense of the developer.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.27  NEW SIDEWALKS; COSTS; ASSESSMENTS.
   In the developed sections of the City that have never previously had
sidewalks constructed, the following shall apply:
   (a)    New sidewalks in a new subdivision shall be paid for entirely by the
developer or purchaser of a lot in a new subdivision as provided by ordinance.
   (b)    When other new sidewalks in other parts of the City are required, the
same shall be constructed at the sole cost of the owner and/or developer. When
the City requires the construction of sidewalks, the City shall share in side
lot relief of corner lots. The owner shall pay for the shorter frontage of a
corner lot and for one-third of the cost of the longer frontage of a corner
lot. The City shall pay two- thirds of the cost of the longer frontage of a
corner lot. In addition, the City shall pay for the sidewalk construction costs
in intersections
   (c)    The City shall include costs of engineering for sidewalk improvements
if required.
   (d)    The City shall pay, in full, costs of all sidewalks at intersections
located within the street right of way.
      (Ord. 2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)
905.28  SIDEWALK REPAIRS; COSTS.
   (a)    If the damage to a sidewalk was caused by action of the City in
raising the grade of the street higher than the sidewalk level so that the
sidewalk damage occurred, or if the damage to the sidewalk was caused by trees
owned by the City in the right of way by growth of roots, then the City shall
pay one hundred percent (100%) of the cost of the repairs.
   (b)    On all other repairs where the damage to the sidewalk was not caused
by the City as set forth in subsection (a) hereof, but where the repairs are
necessary because of deterioration of the sidewalk from time and use, then the
repairs shall be paid eighty percent (80%) by the property owner and twenty
percent (20%) by the City.
   (c)    The Sidewalk Commission shall make the determination of the priority
of sidewalks that should be repaired by the City, where the damage is caused by
the City as set forth in subsection (a) hereof, so that the repairs can be made
based upon the priority list as determined by the Commission according to
available City funds as appropriated in each calendar year.
   (d)    All sidewalks shall be made to the specifications of width, grade and
depth of the concrete over both walk areas and driveway areas according to City
specifications or plans approved by the Municipal Administrator.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.29  APPEALS.
   Any property owner desiring to appeal an order to construct, repair or
replace, or the cost thereof, under Section
905.10,
905.11,
905.12,
905.27 or
905.28 shall promptly after receiving notice of such order, but not later than
thirty days thereafter file such appeal with the Board of Building Standards
and Appeals as established under Section
1301.02 (Section 109) of the Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 2049. Passed 10-22-90.)
905.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter is guilty of a minor misdemeanor on a first offense and shall be fined
not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). On each subsequent offense such
person is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree and shall be fined not
more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or imprisoned not more than
thirty days, or both. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day
during or on which a violation or noncompliance occurs or continues.
(Ord. 2049.  Passed 10-22-90.)

CHAPTER 911
Definitions
911.01   Municipal wastes works.
911.02   City Inspector.
911.03   Municipal wastes.
911.04   Sanitary sewage.
911.05   Industrial wastes.
911.06   Sewer.
911.07   Public sewer.
911.08   Combined sewer.
911.09   Sanitary sewer.
911.10   Storm sewer or storm drain.
911.11   Garbage.
911.12   Properly shredded garbage.
911.13   Building drain.
911.14   Building sewer.
911.15   Natural outlet.
911.16   Watercourse.
911.17   Person.
911.18   Shall; may.
911.19   City.
911.20   Administrator.
911.21   Owner.
 
Unless the context specifically indicates otherwise, the meaning of terms used
in this chapter shall be as follows:
 
911.01  MUNICIPAL WASTES WORKS.
   “Municipal Wastes Works” shall mean all facilities for collecting, pumping
and disposing of municipal wastes.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.02  CITY INSPECTOR.
   “City Inspector” shall mean the Sewer Inspector of the City of Rossford, or
his authorized deputy, agent or representative. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.03  MUNICIPAL WASTES.
   “Municipal Wastes” shall mean a combination of the water-carried wastes from
residences, business buildings, institutions and industrial establishments.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.04  SANITARY SEWAGE.
   “Sanitary Sewage" shall mean domestic wastes contributed by reason of human
occupancy. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.05  INDUSTRIAL WASTES.
   “Industrial Wastes” shall mean the liquid wastes from industrial processes
as distinct from sanitary sewage. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.06  SEWER.
   “Sewer” shall mean a pipe or conduit for carrying municipal wastes.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.07  PUBLIC SEWER.
   “Public Sewer” shall mean a sewer in which all owners of abutting properties
have equal rights, and which is controlled by public authority.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.08  COMBINED SEWER.
   “Combined Sewer” shall mean a sewer receiving both surface runoff and
municipal wastes. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.09  SANITARY SEWER.
   "Sanitary Sewer" shall mean a sewer which carries municipal wastes and to
which storm, surface and ground water are not intentionally admitted.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.10  STORM SEWER OR STORM DRAIN.
   "Storm Sewer" or “Storm Drain” shall mean a sewer which carries storm and
surface waters and drainage, but excludes sanitary wastes.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.11 GARBAGE.
   “Garbage” shall mean solid wastes from the preparation, cooking, and
dispensing of food, and from the handling, storage and sale of produce.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.12. PROPERLY SHREDDED GARBAGE.
   “Properly Shredded Garbage” shall mean the wastes from the preparation,
cooking, and dispensing of food that have been shredded to such degree that all
particles will be carried freely under the flow conditions normally prevailing
in public sewers, with no particle greater than ½ inch in any dimension.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.13  BUILDING DRAIN.
   “Building Drain” shall mean that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a
drainage system which receives the discharge from soil, waste and other
drainage pipes inside the walls of the building and conveys it to the building
sewer, beginning 3 feet outside the building wall.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.14  BUILDING SEWER.
   "Building Sewer" shall mean the extension from the building drain to the
public sewer or other place of disposal.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.15  NATURAL OUTLET.
   "Natural Outlet" shall mean any outlet into a watercourse, pond, ditch, lake
or other body of surface or ground water.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.16  WATERCOURSE.
   “Watercourse” shall mean a channel in which a flow of water occurs, either
continuously or intermittently.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.17  PERSON.
   “Person” shall mean any individual, firm, company, association, society,
corporation or group. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.18  SHALL; MAY.
   “Shall” is mandatory.  "May" is permissive.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.19  CITY.
   “City” shall mean the City of Rossford, Wood County, Ohio.
(Ord.  98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.20  ADMINISTRATOR.
   “Administrator” shall mean the Administrator of the City of Rossford.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
911.21  OWNER.
   “Owner” shall mean the person, firm, company or corporation who owns the
property.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 912
Use of Public Sewers Required
912.01   Unlawful deposits of waste.
912.02   Unlawful discharge of sewage; exception.
912.03   Unlawful sewage disposal facilities.
912.04   Connection with public sewers required.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Compulsory sewer connections - see Ohio R.C. 729.06
 
912.01  UNLAWFUL DEPOSITS OF WASTE.
   It shall be unlawful for any person to place, deposit or permit to be
deposited in an unsanitary manner upon public or private property within the
City of Rossford, or in any area under the jurisdiction of said City, any human
or animal excrement, garbage or other objectionable waste.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
912.02  UNLAWFUL DISCHARGE OF SEWAGE; EXCEPTION.
   It shall be unlawful to discharge to any natural outlet within the City of
Rossford, or in any area under the jurisdiction of said City, any sanitary
sewage, industrial wastes or other polluted waters, except where suitable
treatment has been provided in accordance with subsequent provisions of this
chapter.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
912.03  UNLAWFUL SEWAGE DISPOSAL FACILITIES.
   Except as hereinafter provided, it shall be unlawful to construct or
maintain any privy, privy vault, septic tank, cesspool or other facility
intended or used for the disposal of sewage.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
912.04  CONNECTION WITH PUBLIC SEWERS REQUIRED.
   The owner of all houses, buildings or properties used for human occupancy,
employment, recreation or other purpose, situated within the City and abutting
on any street, alley or right-of- way in which there is now located a public
sanitary or combined sewer or may in the future be located a public sanitary
sewer of the City, is hereby required at his expense to install suitable toilet
facilities therein, and to connect such facilities directly with the proper
public sewer in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, within 60 days
after the date of official notice to do so, provided that said public sewer is
within 500 feet of the property line. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 913
Private Sewage Disposal
913.01   Building sewer connections.
913.02   Permit required.
913.03   Compliance with regulations.
913.04   Connection to public sewers; private facilities abandoned.
913.05   Owner responsible.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Private sewage disposal - see OAC Ch.  3701-29
 
913.01  BUILDING SEWER CONNECTIONS.
   Where a public sanitary sewer is not available under the provisions of
Section
912.04, the building sewer shall be connected to a private sewage disposal
system complying with the provisions of the regulations of the Wood County
Board of Health. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
   
913.02  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   Before commencement of construction of a private sewage disposal system the
owner shall first obtain a written permit from the Wood County Board of Health
and from the City of Rossford.   
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
913.03  COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS.
   The type, capacities, location and layout of a private sewage disposal
system shall comply with all provisions of the regulations of the Wood County
Board of Health and the City of Rossford.   
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
913.04  CONNECTION TO PUBLIC SEWER; PRIVATE FACILITIES ABANDONED.
   At such time as a public sewer becomes available to a property served by a
private sewage disposal system, as provided in Section
912.04, a direct connection shall be made to the public sewer in compliance
with this Title Three, and any septic tanks, cesspools and similar private
sewage disposal facilities shall be abandoned and filled with sand or other
suitable material immediately after connection to the public sewer and shall
comply with all requirements of the Wood County Board of Health and the City of
Rossford.
(Ord.  98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
913.05  OWNER RESPONSIBLE.
   The owner shall operate and maintain the private sewage disposal facilities
in a sanitary manner at all times, at no expense to the City.
(Ord.  98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 914
Building Sewers and Connections
914.01   Unauthorized connections prohibited without permit.
914.02   Permit application; fee; water not metered by Toledo.
914.03   License to construct; revocation; fee.
914.04   Owner to be responsible for costs; indemnity of City.
914.05   Separate sewers required; exception.
914.06   Old sewers connected with new buildings.
914.07   Materials used; approval required.
914.08   Laying sewer pipes; procedure.
914.09   Size and slope.
914.10   Depth and grade; utility connections.
914.11   Low building drains; sewage lifted by artificial means.
914.12   Excavations; requirements.
914.13   Connections to be gastight and watertight.
914.14   Connections; other requirements.
914.15   City Inspector to be notified; inspections.
914.16   Excavations; restoration of property.
914.17   Repair work; stoppages.
914.18   Noncompliance; City to do work; costs.
 
914.01  UNAUTHORIZED CONNECTIONS PROHIBITED WITHOUT PERMIT.
   No unauthorized person shall uncover, make any connections with or opening
into, use, alter or disturb any public sewer or appurtenance thereof without
first obtaining a written permit from the City Inspector (See Appendix No. 7,
Application for Building Sewer Installation and No. 8, Building Sewer
Installation Information).
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.02  PERMIT APPLICATION; FEE; WATER NOT METERED BY TOLEDO.
   All applications for building sewer permits shall be made on a special form
furnished by the City and signed by certified owners or agents. When property
is owned by a company or corporation, the application shall be signed by an
officer of said company or corporation. When the property is a joint ownership
both parties shall sign the application. The application shall be supplemented
by any plans, specifications or other information considered pertinent in the
judgment of the City Inspector. A permit and inspection fee of $25.00 shall be
paid to the City of Rossford at the time the application is filed. Applications
for building sewer permits requested by those not using water metered by the
City of Toledo must be approved by the City of Toledo and such approval shall
be given only upon the agreement of the applicant to such provisions as proper
compliance for metering or measuring service.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.03  LICENSE TO CONSTRUCT; REVOCATION; FEE.
   Only persons, firms, companies, or  corporations of proven ability, and
approved by the Administrator and City Inspector, shall be permitted to
construct Building Sewers and Connections as outlined in this chapter, and
shall obtain a yearly license (See Appendix No. 5, License and No. 6,
Performance Bond) therefor,  and shall further obtain a permit for the
construction of any building sewer, sewer connection or repair from the Sewer
Department of the City of Rossford. Said license shall be approved and signed
by the Administrator and shall expire on the 31st day of December of the year
in which it was issued. This license may be revoked at any time by the
Administrator for any violation of the regulations governing Sewer Contractors.
Fee for said license shall be $10.00. The Sewer Contractor shall take out and
maintain Workers’ Compensation Insurance during the life of his obligation to
Rossford, Ohio. The Contractor shall provide to the Administrator proof of
compliance with the Workers’ Compensation laws and Social Security laws. 
Certificates of insurance policies shall be provided in the types and amounts
acceptable to the Administrator.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.04  OWNER TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COSTS; INDEMNITY OF CITY.
   All costs and expenses incident to the installation and connection of the
building sewer shall be borne by the owner. The owner shall indemnify the City
from any loss or damage that may directly or indirectly be occasioned by the
installation of the building sewer.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.05  SEPARATE SEWER REQUIRED; EXCEPTION.
   A separate and independent building sewer shall be provided for every
building; except where one building stands at the rear of another on an
interior lot and no private sewer is available or can be constructed to the
rear building through an adjoining alley, court, yard or driveway, the building
sewer from the front building may be extended to the rear building and the
whole considered as one building sewer; and with the further exception that two
adjacent buildings may use a common building sewer within the limits of the
public right-of-way. In the latter case, a separate permit shall be required
for each building.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.06  OLD SEWERS CONNECTED WITH NEW BUILDINGS.
   Old building sewers may be used in connection with new buildings only when
they are found, on examination and test by the City Inspector, to meet all
requirements of this chapter.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.07  MATERIALS USED; APPROVAL REQUIRED.
   All material used shall be new and of first quality and acceptable to the
City Inspector. The building sewer shall be of best quality vitrified sewer
pipe (ASTM Specification C13 or C200), with precast plastic or O-ring rubber
joints : or best quality cement concrete sewer pipe (ASTM specification C141,
C1411 and C 76), with O-ring rubber joints; or of plastic pipe of the truss or
solid wall type (ASTM D2680 or D3033 respectively), with cement joints or O-
ring rubber joints; or of cast iron soil pipe (ASTM Specifications A74) with
joints complying with applicable Plumbing Code requirements or other material
acceptable to the City Inspector. The selection of the material to be used for
each specific project shall be approved by the Administrator.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.08  LAYING SEWER PIPES; PROCEDURE.   
   Any sewer contractor before laying pipe or making the connection to any wye,
tee, riser or crossover shall uncover both appurtenances to same to ascertain
the condition.  No sewer pipe shall be laid before the City Inspector is on the
job. The sewer contractor shall determine the slope of the building sewer from
the elevations of the existing City sewer connection and the connection at the
building with the minimum slope being in accordance with Section
914.09. Should there not be enough fall available to provide minimum slope, the
Inspector shall be advised immediately. Sewer pipe laying shall start at the
connection to the main sewer. The sewer contractor shall install a tee at the
point of connection to the City sewer and shall provide adequate testing
facilities to plug this tee in order to water test the completed building sewer
with an equivalent of ten (10) feet of water head, in the presence of the City
Inspector or his authorized agent. Upon satisfactory completion of this test
and approval by the City Inspector or his authorized agent, the sewer
contractor shall connect the sewer to the cast iron pipe building drain
installed by the plumbing contractor which extends at least three (3) feet
beyond the outside wall of the building. At this point the sewer contractor
shall install a joint adaptor, to adapt the cast iron pipe building drain to
the building sewer. Upon completion of the connection to the cast iron pipe,
the sewer contractor shall install the necessary riser pipe above the tee at
the City sewer connection to a point two (2) inches above proposed finished
grade and shall install a premium joint plug.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.09  SIZE AND SLOPE.
   The size and slope of the building sewer shall be subject to the approval of
the City Inspector, but in no event shall the diameter be less than six inches.
The slope of 6-inch pipe building sewers shall be not less than one-eighth inch
per foot. Common services for more than one building and services for
commercial or industrial uses shall be six inches or larger in diameter as
determined by the City Inspector. For depth, trench width and slope
requirements for various classes of sewer pipe see Appendix No. 2 - Table 1,
Building Sewer Installation.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.10  DEPTH AND GRADE; UTILITY CONNECTIONS.
   Whenever possible, the building sewer shall be brought to the building at an
elevation below the basement floor.  No building sewer shall be laid parallel
to and within three feet of any bearing wall, which might thereby be weakened. 
The depth shall be sufficient to afford protection from frost.  The building
sewer shall be laid at uniform grade and in straight alignment insofar as
possible. Changes in direction shall be made only with properly curved pipe and
fittings. Any public or private utility service structure or line shall be
maintained at a minimum of five (5) feet horizontal clearance between said
building sewer and said utility, except for water lines which shall be
maintained at a minimum of ten (10) feet horizontal clearance unless written
approval is secured by person making application from the City Inspector. Any
part of the building sewer that is located within 10 feet of a water line shall
be constructed of cast iron soil pipe, unless written approval is secured by
the person making the application from the City Inspector. No other utilities
will be permitted in the same trench as the building sewer.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.11  LOW BUILDING DRAINS; SEWAGE LIFTED BY ARTIFICIAL MEANS.
   In all buildings in which any building drain is too low to permit gravity
flow to the public sewer,  sanitary sewage carried by such drain shall be
lifted by approved artificial means and discharged to the building sewer. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.12  EXCAVATIONS; REQUIREMENTS.
   All excavations required for the installation of a building sewer shall be
open trench work unless otherwise requested by the City Inspector. Pipe laying
and backfill shall be performed in accordance with ASTM Specification C 12
except that no backfill shall be placed until the work has been inspected. (See
Appendix No. 1 - Recommended Practice for Installing Vitrified Clay Sewer Pipe
and No. 2, Figure 1, Trench Detail).
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.13  CONNECTIONS TO BE GASTIGHT AND WATERTIGHT.
   All joints and connections shall be made gastight and watertight.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.14  CONNECTIONS; OTHER REQUIREMENTS.
   The City cannot guarantee the exact location of any existing wye, tee, riser
or crossover. The connection of the building sewer into the public sewer shall
be made at a riser or wye, if such outlet is available at a suitable location.
Where no properly located riser or wye is available in the public sewer the
owner shall at his expense cut a neat hole into the public sewer to receive the
building sewer, with entry in the downstream direction at an angle of about
forty-five degrees and at the location specified by the City Inspector. The
connection of the building sewer to the public sewer shall in general be above
and near the spring line of  the sewer, but never in the top of the public
sewer. A forty-five degree ell may be used to make such connection, with the
spigot end cut so as not to extend past the inner surface of the public sewer.
A smooth, neat joint shall be made, and the connection made secure and
watertight by approved waterproof joint material before encasing in concrete.
Concrete encasement shall not be considered waterproof. Special fittings may be
used for the connection only when approved by the City Inspector. (See Appendix
No. 3, Figure 2 for construction details of the building sewer connections).
Any damage to the main sewer pipe during installation of the connection shall
require replacement of the entire length of main sewer pipe damaged, at the
sewer contractor's expense.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.15  CITY INSPECTOR TO BE NOTIFIED; INSPECTIONS.
   The applicant for the building sewer permit shall notify the City Inspector
forty-eight (48) hours before an inspection and connection to the public sewer
is to be made. All notifications of this kind shall include the permit number
and the location. The connection shall be made under the supervision of the
City Inspector or his representative. The City Inspector, or any person
authorized by him must be permitted at all times to inspect all work, material
and fixtures.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.16  EXCAVATIONS; RESTORATION OF PROPERTY.
   All excavations for the building sewer installation shall be adequately
guarded with barricades and lights so as to protect the public from hazard.
Streets, sidewalks, driveways, sewers, utilities and other public or private
property disturbed in the course of the work shall be restored in a manner
satisfactory to the City. No sewer contractor shall open any pavement on any
public or private property without first receiving written permission from the
Administrator or proper authorities. At least 48 hours notice shall be given
for this permission. Where the trench method is used through paved or unpaved
streets, roads, driveways, alleys etc. it will be necessary to use granular
material, preferably sand or limestone screenings for backfill. It shall be
placed in layers of not more than six (6) inches and tamped with a mechanical
tamp or puddled in layers at the direction of the City Inspector. After the
backfill is thoroughly compacted, it will be necessary to replace the pavement
with the same type of materials as were removed, and in no case shall
substitute paving materials be used without first securing the approval of the
proper authority. All surplus excavation must be removed from the site to a
location satisfactory to the City, leaving the berms and pavement in
substantially the same condition as it was before construction was started. All
of the above mentioned work and material shall be performed in accordance with
the standard specifications of the Ohio Department of Transportation and the
City or other proper authorities. At all joints where the building sewer passes
under another sewer, drainage pipe, water main or other utility, the line
passed under must be supported by 4" x 4" wood timbers, brick or concrete
masonry and extra precaution will be required in backfilling and tamping the
trench in order  to avoid any danger of a break, settlement or crack in the
line passed under.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.17  REPAIR WORK; STOPPAGES.
   A building sewer permit shall be required for all repair work performed by
the sewer contractor except cases where excavation is not necessary. In the
case of stoppages it shall be the responsibility of the sewer contractor to
uncover the wye, tee or riser, if the property is on the same side as the main
sewer. When the property is on the opposite side, the end of the City crossover
shall be uncovered to determine where the trouble lies. If the stoppage is
found to be either in the main line or in the City crossover, the sewer
contractor shall notify the City Inspector immediately, whose responsibility it
shall be to repair same. The cost of the permit will then be returned to the
sewer contractor. If the stoppage is located anywhere else in the line, it
shall be the responsibility of the owner to repair same at his own cost and
expense.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
914.18  NONCOMPLIANCE; CITY TO DO WORK; COSTS.
   If any Sewer Contractor shall neglect or refuse to comply with the rules and
regulations herein set forth, within twenty-four (24) hours after receiving
written notice from  the Administrator, the City of Rossford will proceed with
the work and the cost involved will be charged to the Sewer Contractor or his
Surety. In cases where it is necessary for the City to proceed with the work,
no further permits will be granted to the Sewer Contractor until he has
satisfactorily complied with the orders of the Administrator and/or the City or
completely reimbursed the City for any cost involved. The Sewer Contractor
shall be required for a period of one (1) year after the completion of the
work, to make all necessary repairs. 
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 915
Use of Public Sewers
915.01   Prohibited discharges.
915.02   Discharges permitted.  (Repealed)
915.03   Prohibited waste materials.
915.04   Industrial wastes.
915.05   Grease, oil and sand interceptors.
915.06   Interceptors maintained by owner.
915.07   Other wastes; preliminary treatment.
915.08   Preliminary treatment facilities; maintenance.
915.09   Control manholes.
915.10   Measurements, tests and analyses; samples.
915.11   Regulations not to limit special agreements.
 
915.01  PROHIBITED DISCHARGES.
   No person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any storm water, surface
water, ground water, roof runoff, subsurface drainage, cooling water or
unpolluted industrial process waters to any sanitary sewer.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.02  DISCHARGES PERMITTED.  (REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE:  Former Section
 915.02 was repealed by Ordinance 2012-61, in light of the enactment of Chapter
934.
915.03  PROHIBITED WASTE MATERIALS.
   No person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any of the following
waste materials to any public sewer or the municipal waste works.
   (a)   Any gasoline, benzene, naphtha, fuel oil or other flammable or
explosive liquid, solid or gas.
   (b)   Any garbage that has not been properly shredded.
   (c)   Any ashes, cinders, sand, mud, straw, shavings, metal, glass, rags,
feathers, tar, plastics, wood, paunch manure or any other solid or viscous
substance capable of causing obstruction to the flow in sewers or other
interference with the proper operation of a municipal waste works.
   (d)   Any noxious or malodorous gas or substance capable of creating a
public nuisance.
   (e)   Any acid or substance capable of damaging the sewers, sewage pumping
stations or force mains.
      (Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.04  INDUSTRIAL WASTES.
   The admission of any industrial wastes containing characteristics critical
to municipal wastes collection and treatment shall be subject to the review and
approval of the City. When in the opinion of the City, preliminary treatment or
control of wastes is necessary, suitable facilities shall be constructed
according to plans approved by the City, or the Administrator may prohibit the
discharge of said wastes to any public sewer.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.05  GREASE, OIL AND SAND INTERCEPTORS.
   Grease, oil and sand interceptors shall be provided when, in the opinion of
the City Inspector, they are necessary for the proper handling of liquid wastes
containing grease in excessive amounts, or any flammable wastes, sand and other
harmful ingredients; except that such interceptors shall not be required for
private living quarters or dwelling units. All interceptors shall be of a type
and capacity approved by the City Inspector, and shall be located as to be
readily and easily accessible for cleaning and inspection.
   Grease and oil interceptors shall be constructed of impervious materials
capable of withstanding abrupt and extreme changes in temperature. They shall
be of substantial construction, watertight, and equipped with easily removable
covers which when bolted in place shall be gastight and watertight.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.06  INTERCEPTORS MAINTAINED BY OWNER.
   Where installed, all grease, oil and sand interceptors shall be maintained
by the owner, at his expense, in continuously efficient operation at all times.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.07  OTHER WASTES; PRELIMINARY TREATMENT.
   The admission into the public sewers of any waters or wastes having
characteristics which vary from normal sewage shall be subject to the review
and approval of the City.  When necessary in the opinion of the City, such
preliminary treatment as may be needed to control the quantities and rates of
discharges or reduce objectionable characteristics or constituents shall be
constructed according to plans approved by the City, or the Administrator may
prohibit the discharge of said wastes to any public sewer.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.08  PRELIMINARY TREATMENT FACILITIES; MAINTENANCE.
   Where preliminary treatment facilities are provided for any waters or
wastes, they shall
be maintained continuously in satisfactory and effective operation, by the
owner at his expense.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.09  CONTROL MANHOLES.
   When required by the City, the owner of any property served by a building
sewer carrying industrial wastes shall install a suitable control manhole in
the building sewer to facilitate observation, sampling and measurement of the
wastes.  Such manhole, when required, shall be accessibly and safely located,
and shall be constructed in accordance with plans approved by the City. (See
Appendix No. 4, Figure 3 for manhole construction details.)  The manhole shall
be installed by the owner at his expense, and shall be maintained by him so as
to be safe and accessible at all times.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.10  MEASUREMENTS, TESTS AND ANALYSES; SAMPLES.
   All measurements, tests and analyses of the characteristics of waters and
wastes to which reference is made in Sections
915.04 and
915.07 shall be determined in accordance with the latest edition of “Standard
Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater”, as published by the
American Public Health Association, and shall be determined at the control
manhole provided for in Section
915.09, or upon suitable samples taken at said control manhole and shall be at
the expense of the owner. In the event that no special manhole has been
required, the control manhole shall be considered to be the nearest downstream
manhole in the public sewer to the point at which the building sewer is
connected.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
915.11  REGULATIONS NOT TO LIMIT SPECIAL AGREEMENTS.
   No statement contained in this chapter shall be construed as preventing any
special agreement or arrangement between the City and any industrial concern
whereby an industrial waste of unusual strength or character may be accepted by
the City for treatment, subject to payment therefor by the industrial concern.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 916
Protection From Damage
916.01   Tampering prohibited; penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Criminal mischief - see GEN. OFF. 
541.04
 
916.01  TAMPERING PROHIBITED; PENALTY.
   No unauthorized person shall maliciously, willfully or negligently break,
damage, destroy, uncover, deface or tamper with any structure, appurtenance or
equipment which is a part of the municipal wastes works.  Any person violation
this provision shall be subject to immediate arrest under charge of disorderly
conduct.
(Ord.  98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 917
Powers and Authority of Inspectors
917.01   Sewage or wastes not covered by regulations; City to regulate.
917.02   Right of entry.
 
917.01  SEWAGE OR WASTES NOT COVERED BY REGULATIONS; CITY TO REGULATE.
   The City shall make and enforce rules and regulations establishing the types
and characteristics of sanitary sewage and industrial wastes and other matter,
not specifically covered in this chapter, which shall not be discharged into
the City sewerage system and the types and characteristics of sanitary sewage
and industrial wastes admissible to the City sewage system only after
pretreatment.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
917.02  RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   The City Inspector and other duly authorized employees of the City bearing
proper credentials and identification shall be permitted to enter upon all
properties for the purposes of inspection, observation, measurement, sampling
and testing, in accordance with the provisions of this chapter. 
CHAPTER 918
Violations and Penalties
918.01   Violation; notice.  (Repealed)
918.02   Liability.
918.99   Penalty.
 
918.01  VIOLATION; NOTICE.  (REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE:  Former Section
918.01 was repealed by Ordinance 2012-61, in light of the enactment of Chapter
934.
918.02  LIABILITY.
   Any person violating any of the provisions of this Title Three - Sewer
Regulations shall become liable to the City for any expense, loss or damage
occasioned the City by reason of such violation.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
918.99  PENALTY.
   Any person who shall continue any violation beyond the time limit provided
for in Section
918.01 shall be guilty of misdemeanor, and upon conviction thereof shall be
fined in an amount not exceeding $50.00 for each violation. Each day in which
any such violation shall continue shall be deemed a separate offense.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
CHAPTER 920
Sewers Generally
920.01   Obstructions; removal.
920.02   Inspectors; inspections; permits; permit fees; license fees and 
license bond.
920.03   Sewer policy for annexed areas.
 
920.01  OBSTRUCTIONS; REMOVAL.
   (a)    No person shall obstruct any public sewer, gutter, ditch or waterway.
   (b)    The City shall have the right and authority to remove any obstruction
placed in any public sewer, gutter, ditch or waterway at the expense of the
property owner found guilty of  obstructing the same.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
920.02  INSPECTORS; INSPECTIONS; PERMITS; PERMIT FEES; LICENSE FEES AND LICENSE
BOND.
   (a)    The Municipal Administrator, with the approval of Council, shall
appoint necessary sewer inspectors.
   (b)    Inspectors shall conform to applicable State laws and local
ordinances, and shall include a check for proper grade of runs, tight joints
and properly made tap or tap joint.
(Ord.  98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
   (c)    If inspection of a sewer that has been functional for at least six
months is required, the property owner shall pay or cause to be paid a fee for
each inspection, in an amount to be established by ordinance, and shall permit
the inspector to enter upon the property for the purpose of inspection.
   (d)    Before construction or installation of any private sewer or drain
system, a building sewer permit shall be obtained.
   (e)    All applications for building sewer permits shall be made on a
special form furnished by the City and signed by certified owners or agents.
When property is owned by a company or corporation, the application shall be
signed by an officer of such company or corporation. When the property is a
joint ownership, both parties shall sign the application.  The application
shall be supplemented by any plans, specifications or other information
considered pertinent in the judgment of the City Inspector.  A permit and
inspection fee, in an amount to be established by ordinance, shall be paid to
the City at the time the application for a sanitary sewer permit or storm sewer
permit is filed.  Applications for building sewer permits requested by those
not using water metered by the City of Toledo must be approved by the City of
Toledo and such approval shall be given only upon the agreement of the
applicant to such provisions as proper compliance for metering or measuring
service.
   (f)    The minimum inspection fee and the fee for each additional inspection
required shall be established by ordinance. 
(Ord.  99-009.  Passed 4-12-99.)
   (g)    A certificate of approval as authority to use plumbing  and drainage
shall be furnished to the contractor or builder by the City and signed by the
City Inspector when construction has been approved. 
(Ord.  98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
   (h)    Original licence: An applicant for an original license must hold a
valid sewer contractor’s license from a governmental entity other than the City
of Rossford.
   Annual renewal: A license holder seeking an annual renewal must present a
valid plumbing contractor’s license from a governmental entity other than the
City of Rossford.
   Fees for the original license and renewal license shall be established by
ordinance.
   Any sewer contractor or builder performing any work for which a permit is
required by this chapter, who has not first obtained the license required by
this section, shall be fined an amount equal to the license fee.
   Any original license that is issued in November or December shall be valid
for the following calendar year.
   (i)   Any person licensed to engage in the construction or reconstruction of
sewers shall file with the Municipal Administrator a bond in an amount to be
established by ordinance, the surety thereon to be approved by the Municipal
Administrator as to sufficiency, and such bond shall be subject to approval by
the Law Director as to form.
(Ord.  99-010.  Passed 4-12-99.)
920.03  SEWER POLICY FOR ANNEXED AREAS.
   (a)    The City shall provide such temporary or permanent sewer service as
may be required to service any areas that are annexed to the City.
   (b)    Should the areas to be annexed be a part of Wood County Main Sewer
District No. 5, they shall remain in the district and any arrangements for the
services to be provided shall be made through the Wood County Sanitary
Engineer.
(Ord. 98-038.  Passed 9-14-98.)
